heisig_chinese_memo: If you walk ten miles, you will need to mend your socks!
heisig_story: Running, we are told here, mends the soil. Observe in the following frames how this kanji can embrace other elements from below, much the same way as the element for road does; and how, in order to do this, the final stroke needs to be lengthened.
koohiiStory1: Hint: This kanji is NOT soil on top of mend, as Heisig claims - that would duplicate one of the strokes. Instead, it is 10 on top of mend. So my story is: If you run 10 miles, you will need to mend your socks!
koohiiStory2: The sports ground needs MENDING after the game as the players have been RUNNING around which has caused the ground to be chopped up.

WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You run and run and run and suddenly you feel your soul („Åù„ÅÜ) leave your body. Still running, you turn around and see your soul running a few steps behind you.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Running really takes it out of you. In this case, it takes your soul out of you. Don't worry, when you stop your soul will collide with you again and everything will be okay. (Probably.)

humanum_full_description_en:
The ancient meaning of " walking " is to run, and later it means to walk. Oracle and early inscriptions like running figures, later inscriptions were added from " stop ", the upper running figure is the first version of " walking ", like a person swinging their arms very sharply during a rush or trot, and the bottom emphasizes the foot from " stop " Action, the original meaning is running. See " Ben ".

Later it was added from "ÂΩ≥" and combined with " zhi " to form "Ëæµ", which means walking. The running figure on the upper part is corrupted into " Yao " in "Shuowen". "Shuowen": "Go, go. From Yao, stop. Whoever stops at Yao, Qu Ye. Anyone who walks will follow." "Shi Ming. "Shi Zirong": "Xu Xing said step", "Swiss walking means trend", "Swiss trend means walking". Duan Yucai's note: "Today's custom is to say that those who are going to be sick are not."

" Go " is borrowed as a place name in the oracle bone inscriptions. For example, "Compilation" 17230: "Zhen: the king goes to disaster." It is also used as a person's name, such as "Compilation" 27939: "Zhen: His order (mand) is a horse." The inscription indicates a person's name or clan name.

The inscription added from " stop " is used as the original meaning of running, and it means: "Xiao dare not run for thousands of years and keep running for public holidays." It means that Xing will not dare to run for ten thousand years sooner or later, and it is called Yang Gong's shelter. It is also used as an official name, such as "walking horse", which is the "fun horse" in classics, responsible for raising horses, "Poetry. Daya. "Yun Han": "Fun Ma Shishi, the restaurant is around." Mao Heng Chuan: "Fun horse, sergeant, the government of the king and horse." Also used as a name. Also under the pretense of being " ancestor ", uncle Zhong and father gui: "Bai (Bo) Zhong (Zhong) and father Su Ye go (ancestral) investigation". It means that your uncle will serve your ancestors sooner or later.

Han silk script is also used as the original meaning, "Mawangdui. Line 325 of the Old Unused Book of the Old Book of Lao Tzu: "Although (only) does not promise, go and not follow." It means to answer respectfully (and go immediately), and not respond casually (and not leave) (see Yang Tianyu) , Sprinting without sprinting. "Book of Rites. "Wang Zao": "Father's fate, but not promise, hands-on practice will vote for it, eat in the mouth will vomit, go without going." Line 169 of the Old Unused Book before the First Volume of Lao Zi: "The fish will flow (swim), the beast will go, all things will survive, and all things will succeed."
humanum_short_description_en: Jia Jin Wen is like a person running with arms swinging (the first article of " walking "). Later, Jin Wen added " stop ", which means running.

The ancient meaning of " walking" is to run, and later it means to walk. Oracle and early inscriptions like running figures, later inscriptions were added from " stop", the upper running figure is the first version of " walking", like a person swinging their arms very sharply during a rush or trot, and the bottom emphasizes the foot from " stop" Action, the original meaning is running. See " Ben". Later it was added from " ÂΩ≥" and combined with " zhi" to form " Ëæµ", which means walking. The running figure on the upper part is corrupted into " Yao" in "Shuowen". "Shuowen": "Go, go. From Yao, stop. Whoever stops at Yao, Qu Ye. Anyone who walks will follow." "Shi Ming. "Shi Zirong": "Xu Xing said step", "Swiss walking means trend", "Swiss trend means walking". Duan Yucai's note: "Today's custom is to say that those who are going to be sick are not." " Go" is borrowed as a place name in the oracle bone inscriptions. For example, "Compilation" 17230: "Zhen: the king goes to disaster." It is also used as a person's name, such as "Compilation" 27939: "Zhen: His order (mand) is a horse." The inscription indicates a person's name or clan name. The inscription added from " stop" is used as the original meaning of running, and it means: "Xiao dare not run for thousands of years and keep running for public holidays." It means that Xing will not dare to run for ten thousand years sooner or later, and it is called Yang Gong's shelter. It means that your uncle will serve your ancestors sooner or later. Han silk script is also used as the original meaning, "Mawangdui.
